heading: Identifying Claim and their Strongest Evidence

topics.heading: Identifying Claim and their Strongest Evidence

questions.question:
Claim: "Pet ownership has mental health benefits."
Supporting Statement: "I always feel less anxious when I play with my dog."
Which type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Meditation can reduce anxiety."
Supporting Statement: "Many of my friends say they feel less anxious after meditating."
Which type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Smoking can lead to lung cancer."
Supporting Statement: "The American Cancer Society reports that smoking is responsible for nearly 85% of lung cancer cases."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Reading regularly can improve vocabulary."
Supporting Statement: "Studies show that people who read daily have a broader vocabulary."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Taking vitamin supplements boosts immunity."
Supporting Statement: "Some people report feeling healthier and getting sick less often after taking vitamins."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.
Identify the evidence that best supports the claim: "Eating a balanced diet improves overall health."
options: "Studies show that people who eat a balanced diet are less likely to develop chronic diseases."
"My friend eats junk food and still feels healthy."
"It’s hard to find time to cook healthy meals."

questions.question:
Claim: "Yoga reduces stress levels."
Supporting Statement: "Many yoga practitioners claim they feel calmer and less stressed after a session."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.
Identify the evidence that best supports the claim: "Recycling helps reduce pollution."
options: "Recycling bins are often colourful and easy to find."
"Reports show recycling plastic reduces the need for new materials, cutting pollution levels by 30%."
"Some people think recycling takes too much time."
"My neighbor doesn’t recycle but still keeps their yard clean."

questions.question:
Claim: "Regular handwashing reduces illness transmission."
Supporting Statement: "A study conducted by the CDC found that frequent handwashing reduces the spread of contagious diseases by 50%."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Eating organic food is better for your health."
Supporting Statement: "Research comparing organic and conventional food consumption suggests small benefits to choosing organic."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.
Identify the evidence that best supports the claim: "Exercise improves mental health."
options: "People enjoy listening to music while exercising."
"Research shows that regular exercise reduces stress and anxiety levels by 40%."
"My cousin exercises every day and likes it."

questions.question:
Claim: "Learning a second language improves cognitive abilities."
Supporting Statement: "Some studies suggest that bilingual people perform better in problem-solving tasks and memory tests."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Eating processed foods increases the risk of diabetes."
Supporting Statement: "Many people believe that a diet high in processed foods can cause health problems over time."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Playing video games can improve cognitive skills."
Supporting Statement: "Research by the University of California found that video game players performed better on tasks requiring quick decision-making and problem-solving."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Consuming too much caffeine can lead to insomnia."
Supporting Statement: "Some people have reported trouble sleeping after drinking caffeinated beverages in the evening."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Eating too much sugar increases the risk of obesity."
Supporting Statement: "A study from the American Heart Association found that high sugar intake leads to higher body fat and obesity risk."
The type of evidence in this statement is considered the __________ evidence.

Claim: "Exercising outdoors boosts mood."
Supporting Statement: "Many people report feeling happier and more energized after exercising in natural settings like parks or beaches."
Which type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Listening to music can reduce anxiety."
Supporting Statement: "Studies indicate that listening to calming music can lower heart rates and help individuals feel more relaxed."
Which type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Reading books regularly improves vocabulary."
Supporting Statement: "Research conducted by the National Literacy Trust found that individuals who read more often tend to have a broader vocabulary."
The type of supporting evidence is this?

Claim: "Drinking green tea boosts metabolism."
Supporting Statement: "Some individuals report feeling more energized and having an increased metabolism after drinking green tea regularly."
Which type of supporting evidence is this?
